1.text: Fold an 8 by 8 in (20 by 20 cm) piece of paper into a triangle.

2.text: Tape a straight drinking straw to the triangle's longest side.

3.text: Punch a small hole next to the end of the straw.

4.text: Attach a string through the hole.

5.text: Tie a small weight to the bottom end of the string.

6.text: Sight the top of a tall object through the straw.

7.text: Move forward or backward until the string lines up with the triangle.

8.text: Use a tape measure to find the distance between this position and the base of the tall object.

9.text: Add your height at eye level to get the final answer.

11.text: Tape a straw along the straight edge.

12.text: Tie a string through the small hole on the straight edge.

13.text: Attach a small weight to the dangling end of the string.

14.text: Sight the top of a tall object through the straw.

15.text: Measure the angle using the protractor.

16.text: Calculate the tangent of this angle.

17.text: Measure your distance from the object.

18.text: Use your measurements to calculate the height of the object.
